notes.text:
A vulnerability in the affected products could allow an unauthorized attacker with network access to perform a denial-of-service attack resulting in loss of real-time synchronization.

Siemens has released new versions for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens recommends specific countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: 
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: The use of Siemens Security Advisories is subject to the terms and conditions listed on: https://www.siemens.com/productcert/terms-of-use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

references.summary: SSA-349422: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Industrial Real-Time (IRT) Devices - HTML Version
SSA-349422: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Industrial Real-Time (IRT) Devices - CSAF Version

document.title: SSA-349422: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Industrial Real-Time (IRT) Devices

revision_history.summary: Added solution for SINAMICS SL150 V4.7, SIPLUS devices now explicitly mentioned in the list of affected products, correction in section "Workarounds and Mitigations"
Added solution for SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family
Added SIMATIC ET200ecoPN product variants (MLFB IDs) that are not affected
Added additional SIMATIC ET200ecoPN model (6ES7148-6JG00-0BB0) as not affected
Clarified that no remediation is planned for ET200 devices
SIMATIC S7-300 CPU family expanded with product specific designations, patch links and MLFBs. Added fix for SINUMERIK 840D sl.
SIMATIC S7-400 CPU family expanded and fix added for supported versions, no fix planned for other S7-400 versions
Removed SIMATIC S7-400 CPU devices without fix, as they do not support PROFINET and are not affected
Listed affected products individually instead of product families (e.g., for SIMATIC ET 200AL/MP/SP/pro IM families); added affected SIPLUS devices (e.g., SIPLUS ET 200xx IM)
Added fix for SINAMICS G150 and SINAMICS S150

notes.text: An attacker with network access to an affected product may cause a denial of service condition by breaking the real-time synchronization (IRT) of the affected installation.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Disable SNMP in Versions 1 and 2c, if supported by the product.
Enable SNMP v3 if required and supported by the product to restrict the vulnerability to authenticated users.
Enable access protection and change default credentials for SNMP service, if possible
Restrict network access to port 161/udp of the affected product.
Currently no fix is planned
